page.title: 18THEN AND NOW-70 YEARS AGO.
page.content: Schools have changed.In my day we had slates to write on & you got the stick if you had dirty boots.I had to share my clothes with my brothers & there were plenty of patches.Everyone went home to dinner & walked to school. There was only one car in Chapel.My pocket money started at 1d per week. Later I earned 18shillings a week on the railway but you could rent a house for half-a-crown.You could buy all you needed in Chapel & I think you still can. Chapel was a friendly place & you could go out leaving doors & windows open.Now the town is bigger,living standards are better but we have more vandals.I'm looking forward to the bypass which should help chapel to be quiet again. An interview with an 86 year old resident.
